template.p: This setup is for pharmacy retail companies that purchase and sell products. They maintain the stock lot wise and also manage the expiry of the lots.
The company runs a B2C and B2B Business.

div.a: Flow 1 : Purchase the Product and Manage Stock
Flow 2: B2B Sales: Quotation > Delivery > Invoice
Flow 3: Sales B2C Customer : Point of Sale with Offers

ul.li: Company: two fields have been created in company form: "Drug License Number " and " Drug License Date". They will be used for every outgoing document.
Manufacturer Name (OEM): new menu has been created "Manufacturers" on Contacts to handle Manufacturer specific information.

Medical Type, and Therapeutic Classification: Medical Type and Therapeutic Classification will be managed via Product Attribute. This will provide a way to categorize and classify pharmaceutical products.
Product Tags: Generic Names (ingredient) will be managed via Tags. This will allow easier categorization and searching.

Doctor: new menu has been created "Doctors" on Contacts. This model will include a "Registration Number", which is specific to doctors. This will help you keep track of doctor-related information in your system.
Customer (B2B) / Vendor : "Drug License Number" and "Drug License Date" fields have been created in contact form. This will ensure that the necessary information is collected from Customers/Vendors.

template.h2: Flow 1 : Purchase the Product and Manage Stock
template.p: ‚ÄãTo manage the stock lot number-wise and streamline the purchase order and receipt process for the pharmacy store, a software solution needs to be implemented. Here's an outline of the system's functionalities.

ul.li: Through Purchase application and create Purchase Orders (POs) for specific product ‚ÄúAcetratine 10 mg‚Äù from predefined vendors.
RFQs (Request for Quotations) are sent to vendors, and they respond with rates for each RFQ.
Confirm the order based on the received rates.

template.p: Once the order is confirmed, the system automatically generates a receipt against the purchase order.

p.u: Lot Serial Number and Expiry Date Tracking

template.p: When the material is received, the user can either scan the barcode or manually enter the Lot Number, Expiry Date and Quantity for "Acetratine 10 mg‚Äù product received.
Validate the reception for all quantities at once.
All products have predefined locations (Racks) ‚ÄúRack 2‚Äù for storage in the pharmacy store. This will be done with the help of Putaway Rule functionality.
template.blockquote: Putaway Rule : Defines a Warehouse Assignment Strategy for incoming stock
template.p: Upon validation of the receipt, the system automatically sets the locations (Racks) for the particular products received. "Acetratine 10 mg‚Äù product will be stored at " WH/Stock/Rack 2‚Äù.
template.h2: Flow 2: B2B Sales: Quotation > Delivery > Invoice

ul.li: Go to the Sales module and create a new quotation.
Add the product "Acetratine 10 mg" with a quantity of "100".

template.blockquote: System will automatically apply the B2B discount of 7% by the Sales Price List "Wholesale (B2B)".
template.p: Once the quotation is ready, confirm it to convert it into a sales order.

p.u: Create Delivery Order and Assign Lot Numbers

ul.li: From the confirmed sales order, Open the respective Delivery Order.
In the delivery order, users can find line items for "Acetratine 10 mg" with a quantity of "100".
To assign lot numbers, click on the product line. In the pop-up, specify the lot number and the quantity against that lot number.

template.p: Confirm the delivery order to reserve the products and mark them as ready for delivery.
Once the delivery is validated, go back to the sales order and "Create Invoice".
This will create an invoice based on the delivered products.
template.blockquote: The invoice will consider the discounted price due to the applied B2B customer discount.
template.h2: Flow 3: Sales B2C Customer : Point of Sale with Offers
template.p: Some businesses run promotion programs for specific products. Create the Point of Sale Order for the product "Himalaya Baby Powder 100 g", apply a "Buy 2 Get 1" promotion, and accept payments using different methods like cash, bank, or customer accounts. Here's a step-by-step breakdown:

ul.li: Select the product "Himalaya Baby Powder 100 g".
System already has a Promotion program with the name "Buy 2 Get 1".

template.p: When a customer wants to purchase "Himalaya Baby Powder 100 g," add "3" quantity. When you select this product at that time, the system will fetch the price from the product master and enter the Lot Number "A-003".
The POS system should automatically recognize the "Buy 2 Get 1" promotion and adjust the total price accordingly.
template.blockquote: The customer should only be charged for the 2 units, with the 3rd unit being free.
template.p: Once the order total is calculated ($191.59), select the payment method (Cash).
While Processing the payment, the customer gives $200 as cash payment. Change amount as $8.41 gets automatically calculated. Validate the Order and Print Receipt.
template.blockquote: You can use the following payment methods: Cash, Bank or Customer Account.
